review: "Red One #1" has some intriguing elements, but overall, it didn't resonate with my preferences. The artwork, while beautifully detailed and vibrant, couldn't compensate for a story that felt disjointed and contrived. The hyper-sexualized portrayal of the female lead character was particularly off-putting and seemed to detract from the overall narrative. While I appreciate the attempt to blend Cold War espionage with superhero tropes, the execution left much to be desired. I hope future issues will address these issues and provide a more cohesive and respectful story.
